thread.title: Report: Tottenham to move for Belgian international striker
thread.title_full: Report: Tottenham to move for Belgian international striker

title: Report: Tottenham to move for Belgian international striker
text:
Filed: Sunday, October 25, 2015 at 01:52 UK Last Updated: Sunday, October 25, 2015 at 01:52 UK 
Tottenham Hotspur are reportedly weighing up a January bid for Belgian international striker Laurent Depoitre . 
The 27-year-old scored 14 goals as Gent won their first domestic title in their 115-year history last season, and he was handed his first senior international cap in the Euro 2016 qualifier against Andorra two weeks ago, scoring in a 4-1 win. 
The Sunday People claims that Spurs manager Mauricio Pochettino sent scouts to watch the Â£10m-rated forward in action for his club this weekend for the fourth time as the club consider whether to make an offer when the transfer window opens. 
Depoitre is under contract until 2017 but the report claims that he is tempted to move to White Hart Lane to link up with Belgium teammates Jan Vertonghen, Toby Alderweireld, Mousa Dembele and Nacer Chadli. 
The Londoners are also thought to be keen on making a move for Premier League top scorer Jamie Vardy to bolster their attack with Harry Kane having scored just once in 13 club appearances this season.
